alert.note: Alert for Pike; Wayne (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 30 at 11:32PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central New York and northeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, in central New York, Broome, Delaware, Otsego and Sullivan. In northeast Pennsylvania, Pike and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1130 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated pockets of moderate to heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.75 inch are expected over the area. This along with earlier rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oneonta, Honesdale, Walton, Delhi, Deposit, Blooming Grove, Sidney, Paupack, Damascus, Callicoon, Davenport, Worcester, Colchester, Maryland, Meredith, Sterling, Cochecton, Pittsfield, Waymart and Andes. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
